text: Almost without colour, just a touch of green. Floral, tree fruits, light koji. Touch of acidity in the back, but also with quite a bit of sweetness as well.
Bottle - Light melon and some liquorice. Light cantaloupe, liquorice and along finish. Delicate and nice with lots of liquorice.

Pours as mostly clear water so appearance is funny to rate. Aroma of sweet fruit as well as citrus and some light rice. Sweet with a very light alcoholic backbone. Would be a good introduction to Daiginjo as it is a good mix of flavor, not super citrus-y or sweet. Excellent.
Very floral. Actually has a grapefruit component, almost like a hop. Pure white in color, cloudy. A champagne flowery finish.

Saki Flight sampled at Sakegura with Linh and Zahra. Clear body with light cloudy haze. Aroma is fresh fruit - peaches, strawberries and melon. Alcohol on the nose as well, but not as aggressive as some of the other sakes we tried along side this one. Flavors include rice wine, vanilla, wonderful combination of fruit and alcohol. This sake seemed to be a bit more delicate with the fruit character and alcohol playing together well.

Grabbed some quick sushi with wife and kid and couldnt pass up affordable daiginjo. Pours light Chardonnay. Nose is big tropical fruit and rice. Tastes of overripe honeydew, pineapple, rice, vanilla, and some white wine. Pretty big flavors and creamy texture. Delightful

300 ml bottle. Clear pour. Banana, floral and soft spring-like aroma. Smooth, medium body. Less complex than other junmai daiginjou, and has a light alcoholic and rice-flavor finish typical of a lesser sake. Overall a nice and approachable sake

Bottle at T&Ms sake and bukakke fest. Pours a clear almost colourless. Sweet with aromas of marzipan. Also hints of vanilla. Very nice and mild. Medium to light bodied. Hints of white pepper and alcohol towards the finish. Light dry finish with more vanilla.

Bottle.

A- Apples, Lemons, citrus, alcohol.

A- Light color, clear liquid.

T- Medium sweetness, apples, lemons.

P- Light body, thin texture, high carbonation, crisp dry finish.

O- A good sake that is very dry and mildly sweet.

Clear, light straw color like white wine. Floral, earthy aroma with light fruity and rice notes. Flavor is earthy, of sweet vanilla and custard with notes of apple and pineapple. Light, smooth body with slightly spicy finish.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Bottle in Tokyo. Clear watery - no head. Dry. Fruity. Citrus. Plums. Light sulfor. Some light plastic/badedyr. Wooden. Licorice.  Charcoal/smokey notes. Apple. Green apple freshness. Light flowery notes. Some fat caramelised pear notes in the taste. Dry light alcoholic finish.

This bottled Sake from rbsg #49 poured a head of frothy fine to medium sized clear colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a and a oily lacing. The aroma was polished rice and mild vinous. . The strong flavor contained notes of polished rice rice vinous and alcohol. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

I have a 300ml bottle of dassai 23 waiting for a special occasion so I wont compare the two but- Ive had a handful of daiginjos now- this imo is better than gekkikan horin, pure dusk, and in general just about as good as it gets.   Also incredible price its fantastic.
(Bottle)  Pours a clear body with nice legs.  Aroma of almond, marzipan, juniper berries, and rice.  Flavor of almond, juniper, pineapple, ginger, and citrus.

Sampled at RBSG 10 thanks to kyotolefty.  Pours clear like water.  Nose is sweet fruity, anise, florals with some alcohol.  Flavors are same; sweet, fruity, anise and spikes of alcohol.  This was much different than any other sake I had ever tried.

Pours clear with no head and some nice legs.  Smells very sweet, fruity, and tropical.  Pineapple, coconut, white grape, and rice.  Flavor has an interesting anise flavor to go along with the fruit.  A little bit boozy, but still drinkable.  Not quite as much on the tropical note, but there is a hint of coconut and pineapple to it.
18 cl bottle. Pours clear with no head. Aroma is smooth fruity, light wineous. Smooth, fruity and lingering mellow. Smooth fruity and lingering into the finish.
From bottle at Sakebar, Paris. Transparant. Dry and herbal, a slight hint of coconut. Subtle.
Bottle at Kamei Royale in Vancouver. Pours clear. Aroma is sweet fruits. Taste is also sweet and fruity with hints of floral herbs. Very smooth on the palate.
Bottle @ chriso. Pours a clear water color with no head. Has a sweetish yeasty spicy rice aroma. Sweetish grainy spicy weak yeasty flavor. Has a sweetish spicy grainy finish.
Bottle at Chris Os Pre-GBBF Shindig 2011. Looks almost like water. Tart perfumy aroma with raspberry. Slightly sweet and tart flavor with raspberry, honey and starch. Oily warming mouthfeel.

Bottle 180ml. @ chriso s Pre-GBBF Shindig 2011.Cristal clear water colour with no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, pineapple, light earthy rice. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, fruity, rice, smooth, coconut. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20110730]

Water colour, no head. Aroma is liquorice, fruits, some earth and mild sweetness. Flavour is liquorice, fruits, alcohol and some mild strange sweetness. Very nice.

Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 11. It pours clear. The nose is sweet plum, nail varnish remover and floral. The taste is brioche, pineapple, plum, light saltiness, floral and some alcohol warmth. Crisp and clean. Very drinkable stuff.
Bottle at ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2011. Clear pour, no head. Smooth aroma and flavor. Lightly sweet, lightly fruity. Creamy. Is that cheese? Nice drinker.
Bottle at Chris Os pre GBBF shindig, 2011. First Sake rate. Sweet pineapple nose. Sweet, juicy fruit flavour.
Chris pre Gbbf shindig 2011.  Clear very pale gold.  Juniper aroma.  Wow that is amazing.  Smooth. Just really good juniper herb.  Smooth
bottle at chriss ... clear ... barest hint yellow ... soft sweet earthy  rice nose ... sweet floral fruit ... hint of pineapple ... some alcohol ... creamy ... light rice ...
A Mes rate. At Chris Os pre GBBF.superb nose. Some booziness showing through but the fruity almost juniper character is lovely. Slightly floral in the mouth. Excellent fruity finish. Really tasty.

Slightly tainted clear pour.  Cantelope in the nose with a little ricey kick around the edges, flavors again of sweet melon and ricey alcohol...alcoholic, sweet, but with a melony booziness to it that brings it to refinement.  Not too shabby really.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2010 Nicely sweet, grain, and floral aroma. Off clear, slight yellow. Flavor is fruit with Passion fruit/Asian pair and other creamy tropical fruit, cotton candy hints, alcohol and honey.  Slightly wet. Very good.
bottle shared by Kyotolefty - arouma is menthol and anise. light, boozey with a touch of earthy must.

Bottle at the Grand Tasting during RBSG courtesy of KyotoLefty.  Pours a water clear color.  Sweet juicy fruit aromas, and isopropyl.  Sweet and lightly boozy, slowly warms into a rather big booze note, but falls away quickly.  Soft spice on the finish.  Smooth in spite of the booze spikes.

Shared (likely by kyotolefty) at the RBSG grand tasting. Pours clear and looks a bit like water. The aroma is complex and interesting with some pear and black licorice along with a nice booziness. The flavor is spicy and fruity with some rice and a good warming booziness.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2012 Sample from a 720ml bottle. Pours with a clear body with strong legs. Aroma is very nice. Quite sweet and fruity with peaches, strawberries, jasmine, ginger and orange blossoms. Taste is sweet, stone fruit, light ginger. Very low level of koji presences. Nice and thick body with absolutely no hint to the abv. Velvety mouthfeel. A pretty awesome Diaginjo.  Have had several times since. Great, clean, complex and flavorful daiginjo. Well hidden alcohol and crisp. Delicious!
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2011 300 ml bottle. Aroma of melon, citrus, pineapple, spice and sawdust. Flavors of citrus and tropical fruits, rice. Quite sweet, with a full, soft mouth. Great stuff.
